section.title: Registering &rhla; or CentOS Linux with &rmt;
section.para: Use this procedure to register &rhel; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber; with the &rmt; server.

listitem.para: The &rmt; server is running rmt-server version 2.15 or later.
The &reponame; &productnumber; repositories are available on the &rmt; server.
The system you want to register can access the &rmt; server.
The system you want to register is up to date. &productname; only supports the latest minor release of &rhla; &productnumber; or CentOS Linux &productnumber;.
The package yum-utils is installed on the system you want to register. This package is installed by default in most installations, but not in a Minimal Install.
You have a &productname; subscription activated in the &scc;.
You have removed the system from any &rh; subscription services it was registered to.

step.para: Save the script in as rmt-client-setup-res.
Run the rmt-client-setup-res script with the URL of the &rmt; server as a parameter:
The script installs &suseconnect; and its dependencies, then downloads and runs the rmt-client-setup script, which performs the following tasks:

listitem.para: Imports the keys with gpg --import and rpm --import.
Downloads the CA certificate from https://RMT_SERVER/rmt.crt.
Imports the CA certificate to the trust store.

step.para: You should see Successfully registered system.
You should see the following output:
